summary.title: CPE Project I

AND.other: Senior standing in the BS.CPE program

summary.description: This course is a largely self-directed senior project in which students demonstrate their mastery of the subjects covered in the BS.CPE program.

course-outcomes.outcome: Develop a set of system requirements and specifications for a large system.
Identify and use appropriate time management skills and tools.
Develop a moderately complex computer based system that employs both hardware and software.
Prepare and deliver oral presentations with effective use of visual aids.
Understand the role of quality in system development and ways to achieve it.
Create, and strive to adhere to, a project schedule.
Document a system design, including the creation of a users manual and the maintenance of a project notebook.

course-content.topic: Design methodology, the common project: proposal and brainstorming.

laboratory-studio-outcomes.summary: Most of the laboratory time is to provide the students the time to execute their projects as they see fit. A few laboratory periods are used for instructional demonstrations, group activities, or presentation rehearsal. The instructors make themselves available for consultation on hardware, software, interfacing, or systems issues during the laboratory time.
